Package embedding.shortestPaths

Class AdjacencyList

java.lang.Object
embedding.shortestPaths.AdjacencyList
public class AdjacencyList
extends java.lang.Object
An AdjacencyList represents an undirected weighted graph. This representation is best suited for sparse graphs.

The total amount of nodes must be decided at the time of creation. The vertices of a graph with n vertices are the integers 0≤i<n. In conjunction with an array of any type this can be used to represent a graph with the elements of that array as vertices by using their indices in the AdjacencyList.

Author:
Anton Ballmaier

  • Field Details

    • length

      public final int length
      Number of nodes in the represented graph

    • data

      private final java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Double>[] data
      Representation of the graphs edges.
      data[i].get(j)
      is the weight of the edge from i to j.

  • Constructor Details

    • AdjacencyList

      public AdjacencyList​(int vertices)
      Constructs a new AdjacencyList object using the given number of vertices. The vertices of a graph with n vertices are the integers 0≤i<n.
      Parameters:
      vertices - the number of vertices

  • Method Details

    • addEdge

      public void addEdge​(int from, int to, double distance)
      Adds an edge to the represented graph weighted with the given distance. Since the graph is undirected, the order of the first two arguments doesn't make a difference. If the distance of an aready existing edge is set, the distance is updated. Setting a distance to Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY will result in removing that edge.
      Parameters:
      from - first vertex of the edge
      to - second vertex of the edge
      distance - weight / distance of the edge
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given distance is negative
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given distance is not 0 and the vertices are the same

    • distance

      public double distance​(int from, int to)
      Returns the weight / distance of an edge. The distance from one vertex to the same is always 0.
      Parameters:
      from - first vertex of the edge
      to - second vertex of the edge
      Returns:
      the weight / distance of the edge between the given vertices or Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if no such edge is defined.

    • neighbors

      public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> neighbors​(int vertex)
      Returns the neighborhood of a vertex. A vertex is defined as a neighbor of the given vertex if there is a edge connecting the two vertices.
      Parameters:
      vertex - the vertex
      Returns:
      the set of neighbors of the given vertex

    • removeEdge

      public void removeEdge​(int from, int to)
      Removes an edge if present.
      Parameters:
      from - first vertex of the edge
      to - second vertex of the edge

    • toAdjacencyMatrix

      public double[][] toAdjacencyMatrix()
      Constructs a double[][] array from this AdjacencyList containing the edge weights of every edge in the graph. In any case the entry of the matrix will be:
      toAdjacencyMatrix()[i][j] == distance(i, j)
      Returns:
      the quadratic matrix of distances
